intro: Boerlagiodendron boerlagei, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, light grey bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in catkins, followed by woody, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in dry, well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
